alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 6:42PM MST until February 23 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST /1 PM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...A prolonged period of dangerously cold wind chill readings of 15 to 25 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State area. However Dundy and northern parts of Yuma County may have wind chills fall close to 30 degrees below zero. * WHEN...Until noon MST /1 PM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite may occur on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The coldest wind chills will occur around 7 AM MST or 8 AM CST.
info.instruction: If you must go outside, wear multiple layers of clothing including a hat and gloves. Frostbite causes loss of feeling and color around the face, fingers, and toes. Signs of frostbite include numbness and white, grayish-yellow, firm, or waxy skin. Hypothermia is an unusually low body temperature. A body temperature below 95 degrees is an emergency. Signs of hypothermia include shivering, exhaustion, confusion, fumbling hands, memory loss, slurred speech, or drowsiness.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
